definitions: the state of being strong enough to withstand adverse conditions or rough handling
shortDefinitions: state of being strong enough to withstand adverse conditions

definitions: the quality of being difficult to cut or chew

examples.text: gristle contributes to the toughness of meat

shortDefinitions: quality of being difficult to cut or chew

definitions: the ability to deal with hardship or to cope in difficult situations

examples.text: they showed great mental toughness to keep going

shortDefinitions: ability to deal with hardship or cope in difficult situations

definitions: the state of being difficult and requiring determination or effort

examples.text: I underestimated the toughness of the job
the brutal toughness of the training

shortDefinitions: state of being difficult and requiring determination or effort

definitions: demonstration of a strict and uncompromising approach

examples.text: the toughness of the regime was legendary

shortDefinitions: demonstration of strict and uncompromising approach

definitions: the quality of being strong and prone to violence

examples.text: his reputation for toughness on the street
they were known to file their teeth to show their toughness

shortDefinitions: quality of being strong and prone to violence
